page.title: 15Doctor's Gate Footpath
page.content: {Doctor's Gate}is a local footpath leading from Old Glossop onto {Bleaklow.}It is a popular route with walkers as it joins onto the{Pennine {Way.}It used to be a Roman road from{ {Melandra Castle}near Glossop to the Roman fort at{Brough.}In places it is paved. A local legend is that the name comes from a{local doctor} who was under the power of the{Devil.}To get his freedom he had to race against the {Devil}on horseback and win. The{doctor}lost the race because the{Devil}used black magic. The{doctor}found out that as long as he stayed on the other side of the river he was free from the power of the{Devil.}
